snippet: Several prominent Native American groups on Monday called for the Justice Department to investigate the treatment of Indian children in public child-welfare systems and private adoptions.
abstract: Several prominent Native American groups call for the Justice Department to investigate treatment of Indian children in public child-welfare systems and private adoptions; groups claim that federal law intended to keep Indian children from being removed from their families is being routinely sidestepped.
lead_paragraph: Several prominent Native American groups on Monday called for the Justice Department to investigate the treatment of Indian children in public child-welfare systems and private adoptions.

headline.main: Indian Groups Question Public Child-Welfare Practices
headline.print_headline: Indian Groups Question Public Child-Welfare Practices
